instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Greenlight no fan spin
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Greenlight no fan spin
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Any history available?
Please post more information.

Do you get L7770 voltage?

Did you press power button?
This board doesn't start by itself; is an old C2D, not iCore.
Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Greenlight no fan spin
threads.message:
Thank you and hello.

I don't have any history of the board i found a few of these <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> model boards only and am trying to go through them and see if i can fix it(fan spin).
(I am trying to learn)

I have not tried the power button I did not know it was necessary to turn on thank you for that explanation.

L7770 gives me 1.06v on both sides

I do not know how to Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>. Does this mean press the power button then test?

Thanks again

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Greenlight no fan spin
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Greenlight no fan spin
threads.message: The fan spin turns on when I press the wire to ground and goes above 1 amp for that moment. Is it normal for it to turn off after? Also I do not know how to check for drop pulse. The schematic shows the <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> is inside <CHIP>U1400</CHIP> and <CHIP>U4900</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Greenlight no fan spin
threads.message:
"Is it normal for it to turn off after?"
I hope you didn't maintain the short over <RESISTOR>R5015</RESISTOR>/16 pads.
Make just temporary contact, like pressing power button.
Yeah, <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> is not available on this platform; check reaction at <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> instead.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Greenlight no fan spin
threads.message:
Nope I just made temporary click but i thought it would stay on. <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> has 3.3V when making contact.
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Greenlight no fan spin
threads.message:
Once remove the short, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> stays high?
Also check <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>.
If yes, you should get voltage on big coils.
